title: What is the currency of France before Euro? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Was” the currency.It were “Francs français”, also called “FF”Then, by a terrible inflation of it’s value it was devaluatet by one hundred.Replaced by the “nouveaux Francs”, called NF. I am german. When my parents went to France, for hollidays with me child, they gave me weekly money. Five Francs per week. Those were light pieces, aluminium or such. I kept what I could, one year the next. One year, anew hollidays in France, I wanted to pay icecream with those. When I showed my money pieces, the vendor went furiorous, he hit me. My precious five Francs from the year before were worth only five cents. When changing to €uro, things went similarily.Firstly, very rapidly, one could buy for one € about what costed one NF, before.Devaluation about seven to one.Since then, things got worse. Strongly bad.

From 1 January 1999, the value exchange rate of the FRENCH FRANC against the euro was set at fixed parity of €1 = 6.55957 F. Euro coins and notes replaced the franc entirely between 1 January and 17 February 2002.
